overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a thorough analysis of time-series data with 96 points, focusing on handling anomalies and short data constraints. The approach prioritizes robustness by using median-based heuristics to mitigate the impact of outliers in the last day's data, while acknowledging limitations of complex models like SARIMA due to limited historical data.
common_data_patterns: Anomalies in last day's data (negative values)
No actual missing values despite user warning
Short data length (only 4 days of history)
key_insights: Median aggregation provides robustness against anomalies compared to mean
Small dataset size (96 points) limits complex model applicability
Explicit handling of timestamp generation for multi-day forecasts
Data rounding for consistency with original precision
Rejection of complex models (SARIMA/ETS) due to insufficient seasonal cycles
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step analysis, including data inspection, anomaly handling, model comparison, custom heuristic development, and output formatting.
